intro: Centaurium erythraea var. subcapitatum, commonly known as the lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, bright red to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and stream banks. It has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The flowers are arranged in a dense, spike-like cluster at the top of the stem, making it visually distinctive.
